By Melissa Torres ,
3 hours ago
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (KRQE) – A school in northwest Albuquerque is implementing an innovative tool to promote the love of reading and boost student success.
Story continues below

And put those tokens towards books in this vending machine. “I love reading so much and I personally just went to the book fair and now I have a bunch of cool books and now I get this book and it’s so awesome,” said 2nd grade student Ava.
Marie Hughes Elementary School has been working with the Taylor Ranch Neighborhood Association to purchase the vending machine and they finally unveiled it on Tuesday.
“When we unveiled it, the cheers the wondering, the parents walking by and asking staff members about how do I get one of those? How do I get a book? Was really exciting to see, so I’m just thrilled to see people wanting to read and having a way to promote reading,” said Principal Jenna Bludworth.
The goal is to encourage reading by making books a reward with the novelty of the vending machine that gives students a book of their choice that they can keep. “I think that we have to keep things exciting and fun and that’s how we get students interested,” continued Bludworth. “And that is the goal as soon as we get them interested this is easy to stay interested in it’s getting them here. And this is the vessel to create a love of reading.”
So far, the machine has been a success and students are looking forward to earning more tokens. “I got a token to put in the vending machine to get a book and it’s pretty nice,” said 3rd grade student Mattison.
Principal Bludworth told KRQE News 13 that she wants every student to be able to use the machine so they are still coming up with ways to earn tokens.
For those interested in donating new books to go inside the vending machine, you can contact Marie Hughes Elementary directly.
